div.div:
Enhances vessel name generation with country phrases
Updates the vessel name generation logic to incorporate random phrases based on the country associated with the city.
This change enriches the variety of generated vessel names by replacing static city names with dynamic country phrases, improving the overall user experience and thematic relevance of the vessel naming process.

Adds country-specific cultural phrases to utility
Enhances the utility by incorporating a wide range of cultural phrases associated with various countries.
This addition enriches the existing functionality, allowing for a more diverse representation of global cultures, which may improve user experience in applications utilizing this utility.

Adds country-specific name phrases for enhanced localization
Introduces a new data structure that includes arrays of culturally significant names and phrases for various countries, improving localization support.
This change enhances the application's ability to represent diverse cultural contexts and enrich user experiences across different regions.

Adds descriptive utilities for cruise and city experiences
Introduces a new module that generates engaging descriptions for cruise experiences and cities.
Includes a variety of adjectives and descriptors to enhance the appeal of travel-related content, aiming to improve user engagement and marketing efforts.
Enhances the overall storytelling potential for travel experiences.

Adds comprehensive country language mappings
Introduces a new mapping of languages spoken in various countries, including second languages for tourism and business.
Enhances the `getRandomLanguages` function to support country-specific language retrieval alongside regional options, ensuring English inclusion where relevant.
Improves the logic to handle duplicates and enforce unique language selections.
This update facilitates better language management for international contexts and enhances user experience in multilingual scenarios.

Adds new names to feminine and last names lists
Introduces several new names to the feminine and last names collections to enhance diversity and inclusivity.
The added names include: - Feminine names: Joshua, Christopher, Matthew, Alexander, Nicholas - Last names: Charlotte, Olivia
These changes aim to broaden the name options available in the application.

Refactors testimonial generation by using utility functions
Improves the generation of restaurant testimonials by refactoring to utilize utility functions for random name generation and adjective selection.
Removes redundant arrays and streamlines the code, enhancing maintainability and readability.
Additionally, updates the testimonial file generation to include metadata for better tracking and management.

Adds header comments to auto-generated menu files
Implements auto-generated header comments in menu files, including city information and generation timestamp.
This improves maintainability by clearly indicating that the files are generated and should not be edited manually.

Adds auto-generation metadata to restaurant data files
Enhances the auto-generated restaurant data files by including metadata comments.
The comments specify the city name and generation timestamp, providing context for users and preventing manual edits.
This change improves documentation and maintainability of the generated files.

Enhances crew member generation script documentation
Improves the documentation for the crew member generation script, detailing usage instructions, command-line arguments, and file structure.
Refactors the `generateCrewMember` function to streamline name and language assignment, enhancing readability and maintainability.
Introduces additional comments and auto-generated file metadata for clarity.
These changes aim to facilitate better understanding and usage of the script by developers.

Enhances vessel data generation with new attributes and names
Updates the vessel data generation process by adding an `id` attribute to each vessel object and including a broader array of vessel names to enhance variety.
Refines regex patterns for improved data extraction and ensures the generated files include essential metadata.
Introduces a top speed calculation and a default image URL for vessels, improving overall vessel information quality.
Maintains backward compatibility while enhancing the functionality of the vessel creation process.

Enhances cruise data generation with new descriptors
Introduces new cruise adjectives, city descriptors, and region descriptors to improve the realism and variety of generated cruise itineraries.
Refactors the data generation functions to utilize these descriptors, allowing for more engaging and descriptive cruise titles and experiences.
Removes redundant hardcoded descriptors, ensuring scalability and maintainability of the code.
Implement new feature for user authentication and improve error handling

Updates motorcycle rental configurations for Amalfi Coast and Amsterdam
Refines motorcycle rental data by replacing outdated models, adjusting specifications, and enhancing availability for better user experience.
Implements new motorcycles with updated features, pricing, and requirements across both locations.
Focuses on improving rental offerings and ensuring data accuracy for enhanced customer service.

Refactors car rental data for Amalfi Coast and Amsterdam
Updates car rental listings by removing outdated entries and replacing them with new luxury models.
Enhances user experience by featuring a wider selection of vehicles and improving rental details such as pricing, specifications, and availability.
Ensures consistency in data format and maintains the auto-generated status for future updates.

Adds generation date to motorcycle rental files
Includes the current date in ISO format within the auto-generated city files for motorcycle rentals. This enhancement improves clarity by indicating when the file was created, facilitating better tracking of generated content.

Adds metadata to generated city guide files
Enhances generated city guide files by including metadata such as the tour guide title, region, and generation date.
This improvement aids in better organization and provides context for users interacting with the generated files.

Adds new hotel room options and updates hotel details
Introduces room options for Borgo Antico and Hotel Capri Mare, enhancing the diversity of accommodations available.
Removes outdated room definitions for Grand Hotel Roma, Hotel Bella Napoli, and La Casa di Marco, streamlining the hotel data.
Updates key details for existing hotels, including contact information and cancellation policies, improving user experience and accuracy.

Updates room options generation to include timestamp
Enhances the auto-generated room options file by adding a timestamp indicating when the file was generated.
Imports the RoomOption interface after the timestamp comment for better organization and clarity in the generated content.

Adds generation metadata to homestay location files
Enhances generated homestay files by including metadata such as generation date, city, region, and country.
This improvement aids in tracking the context and origin of the generated data, ensuring better maintainability and clarity for users.

Adds auto-generated file notice and timestamp to hotel files
Includes a warning against manual edits and adds a timestamp for when the file was generated. This improves clarity and maintains accurate documentation for generated files.

Updates homestay listings for Amalfi Coast and Amsterdam
Replaces existing host details with new entries for improved variety and accuracy.
Enhances guest policies, availability times, and contact information for better user experience.
Increases representation of different types of hosts and their unique offerings, making the listings more appealing to potential guests.

Adds generation timestamp to auto-generated city files
Includes a timestamp in the header of auto-generated city files to indicate when they were created.
This helps track file generation times for better version control and auditing purposes.

Adds generation timestamp to city tour files
Includes a timestamp in the auto-generated city tour files to indicate when they were created. This enhances file traceability and aids in maintaining up-to-date documentation for users and developers.

Update generation timestamp for city attractions files
Enhances the auto-generated files by adding a timestamp comment indicating the date of generation.
This change improves the traceability of the files and provides clarity on when the data was last updated, which can be useful for maintenance and debugging purposes.

Adds generation date to city testimonials file
Includes the current date in ISO format as a comment at the top of the auto-generated city testimonials file. This enhancement improves file metadata for better tracking and documentation purposes.

Adds generation date to city car rental files
Includes the generation date in the auto-generated luxury car rental files to provide better context for when the file was created.
This enhancement improves traceability and helps developers understand the recency of the generated data.

Adds timestamp to auto-generated attractions file
Includes the generation date in the header comment of the attractions file to indicate when it was created.
This change enhances traceability and helps prevent manual edits by clearly showing the file's generation time.

Adds new hotel names to the shared hotel data
Introduces several new hotel names to enhance the diversity of options available in the shared hotel data.
These additions aim to improve user experience by offering a broader selection of accommodations.

Enhances screen size hooks with customizable breakpoints
Updates the `useMediumScreen` and `useSmallScreen` hooks to accept a customizable breakpoint parameter, allowing for greater flexibility in screen size determination.
Removes the debounce function to streamline the resize handling process, ensuring immediate updates to screen state.
Sets the initial state upon component mounting and ensures proper cleanup of event listeners during unmounting.

Adds custom hook for large screen detection
Implements a new custom hook that detects if the viewport width exceeds a specified breakpoint.
This improves responsiveness by allowing components to conditionally render based on screen size.
The hook sets up an event listener for window resize events and cleans up after itself to prevent memory leaks.

Removes unused attraction name variable from page logic
Eliminates the redundant attraction name variable, simplifying the event handler for the button click action.
This change enhances code clarity and maintains functionality without unnecessary variables.

Enhances city attraction page layout and responsiveness
Improves the layout of the city attraction page by introducing responsive design elements for better user experience across different screen sizes.
Adds navigation links to explore tours and testimonials, facilitating easier access to related content.
Integrates hooks for screen size detection to dynamically adjust button styles based on the device.
Refines the main content structure for improved clarity and usability.
Update .gitignore to include scripts and source directories

Adds script for full development reset and data regeneration
Introduces a new script that deletes all generated data files and executes generation scripts in the correct order for a complete development environment reset.
This improvement streamlines the development process by automating data cleanup and regeneration, ensuring a fresh state for testing and development.
Improves error handling during script execution.

Standardizes country names and regional designations
Updates country names for consistency, replacing "U.S. Virgin Islands" with "US Virgin Islands" and standardizing "Bosnia & Herzegovina" to "Bosnia and Herzegovina".
Additionally, simplifies regional designations by removing unnecessary qualifiers, such as changing "Georgia (Caucasus)" to "Georgia" and "Catalonia (Spain)" to "Catalonia".
These changes enhance clarity and maintain uniformity across the codebase.

Improves string normalization functions
Updates the `removeSpecialCharacters` function to allow hyphens in addition to alphanumeric characters and spaces.
Adds a new `normalizeString` function that combines accent removal and special character filtering for better string formatting.
These changes enhance the overall string handling capabilities in the utility module.

Refactors attraction details structure for consistency
Updates the attraction details format to a consistent JSON-like structure, enhancing readability and maintainability.
Standardizes opening hours and attributes for various attractions, improving data integrity and future extensibility.
No functional changes are introduced; changes focus on structural improvements for better data handling.

Refactors attraction data structure for better clarity
Updates the attraction data structure to use consistent key formatting and improves readability by organizing the data more clearly.
No functional changes were introduced; the refactor aims to enhance maintainability and facilitate future updates.

Refactors tour themes and titles for better organization
Updates the structure of tour themes and titles to enhance clarity and maintainability.
Introduces new themes and a streamlined title mapping, consolidating and simplifying the existing array for improved usability.
Adds a utility function to remove special characters from titles, ensuring consistency in formatting.
Enhances the overall user experience by providing a more cohesive and organized approach to tour management.

Adds city attractions auditing script
Implements a Node.js script to audit and synchronize city and attraction data.
The script loads city files, attraction basic information, and details, compares them, and generates a comprehensive audit report.
This addition addresses data consistency issues and ensures that the city and attraction datasets are properly aligned and populated.

Adds script to generate missing attraction info for cities
Implements a script that generates basic and detailed attraction information for cities based on existing city files.
The script fills in missing entries without overwriting existing data, ensuring the attraction data remains up-to-date and comprehensive.
It provides default values for attractions not previously listed and includes a fallback mechanism for cities lacking specific attractions.
Generates updated files only when new information is added.

Removes and updates city data in the city constants
Reduces the number of cities listed by removing several entries, streamlining the dataset.
Updates the region for "Amalfi Coast" to "Italy" and changes the region for "Auckland" to "New Zealand."
Additionally, replaces "Bangkok" with "Amsterdam," preserving its details while maintaining clarity in the city dataset.

Adds new cities to the cityFiles list
Updates the cityFiles array to include additional cities, enhancing the geographical diversity of options available.
Removes some existing cities to streamline the list and improve relevance.
Adds new city data for Sapa, providing a detailed description to enrich user experience.

Updates geographic and currency mappings for accuracy
Refines country and city mappings to ensure accuracy, including changes to the representation of Fiji, Patagonia, and several countries' currencies.
Adds new currency rates for Jamaica, Dominican Republic, Taiwan, and Cambodia to enhance currency data completeness.
Removes outdated mappings for Croatia and Eurozone countries to streamline currency associations.
Refactors country names for Bosnia and Herzegovina to improve consistency
Refactors city and region mappings for improved organization and clarity

Updates city names and adds new city entries
Renames "New York" to "New York City" for accuracy.
Adds new city entries for Sitka, Skagway, Svaneti Region, Washington, and Xi'an, enhancing the city dataset.
Improves overall representation of cities in the application.

Refactors hotel filter options for improved clarity
Enhances the filtering logic for hotel options by consolidating unique value extraction into a reusable helper function.
This change streamlines the filtering process, making it easier to manage and understand the conditions for each selection.
Additionally, updates the UI components to utilize the new filtered values, ensuring a consistent and efficient user experience across all filter categories.

Improves car rental filter options functionality
Enhances the filtering logic for car rental options by implementing a dynamic method to generate unique values based on current selections.
This change addresses the need for more accurate filter options in the dropdowns, allowing users to see only the relevant choices based on their selections, thereby improving the overall user experience.
Additionally, it replaces previously hardcoded unique values with dynamically generated ones for various car attributes.

Refactors motorcycle filter logic for improved usability
Enhances the filtering system by replacing hardcoded unique values with dynamic options based on current selections.
This change allows users to see only relevant choices in dropdown menus, improving the overall user experience and making it easier to find motorcycles that meet specific criteria.
Also updates the filtering logic for features, ensuring it accurately reflects the selected motorcycle attributes.

Improves type safety for city data mappings
Enhances type safety by specifying the key types when accessing city-to-region and city-to-country mappings.
This change ensures better type checking and reduces potential runtime errors related to undefined values in the mappings.

Adds new cities and updates existing city information
Enhances the city and country mapping by adding new cities, such as Puerto Vallarta and Punta Cana, and correcting existing entries like Zanzibar.
Updates geographical coordinates and regions to improve accuracy and support for additional locations.
Improves overall data completeness for geographic utilities.

Adds new cities and enhances city information
Updates the city data by adding numerous new cities and enhancing existing city entries with additional details such as region, country, subtitle, and quotes. This change enriches the dataset and provides a more comprehensive representation of global cities.
Refactor code structure for improved readability and maintainability
Refactor HomePage component: update layout styles, improve header semantics, and remove testimonials section
Add process-city-attractions script to generate TypeScript files for city attractions with structured data and tags
Fix command usage paths in documentation for generate-city-crew script
Fix command usage paths in documentation for generate-city-cars script
Enhances city attractions generator by adding geo-utils for region and country data, updating command line argument parsing, and improving opening hours handling.

Updates attraction details to include more specific data
Refines the attraction data structure by replacing default opening hours with specific values from the details object.
Adds new fields for entry fees, entry fee category, and features to enhance the attraction information provided.
This improves the overall accuracy and richness of the attraction data presented to users.

Refactors attraction details to use detailed opening hours format
Converts the opening hours for attractions into a structured format, allowing for more detailed hour specifications per day.
This change enhances the clarity and usability of the attraction details, making it easier to manage and understand opening times.
Additionally, it standardizes the entry fees and features for various attractions across different cities, improving maintainability.

Adds utility functions for dynamic tool resource loading
Introduces a new function to dynamically import tool resources based on toolkit and tool name.
Enhances error handling by logging issues when exports are not found or when loading fails, returning an empty array in such cases.
This change lays the groundwork for better modular resource management in the application.

Updates attraction interface to enhance entry fee details
Refines the `BaseAttraction` interface by replacing `openingHours` with `openingHoursDetailed`, using a more structured format for weekly availability.
Adds `entryFees` and `features` properties for better categorization of attraction details, improving data handling and user experience.
Introduces the `EntryFeeDetail` interface for clearer representation of entry fee categories and price ranges.

Update import path for attraction utility functions
Refactors the import statement for attraction utility functions to use the more accurately named module, enhancing code clarity and maintainability.
No functional changes are introduced by this update.

Removes outdated attraction utility file
Eliminates the attraction utilities file that contained extensive information about various tourist attractions, simplifying the codebase.
This change addresses redundancy and potential maintenance issues by removing unused data.
No replacement data is provided, indicating a shift in how attraction information will be managed or accessed in the future.

Refactors attraction data handling for improved clarity
Updates import structure for attraction data utilities.
Implements a special case for Seattle to accommodate naming conventions.
Enhances error handling for missing attraction information and defaults opening hours to a specific range if detailed data is unavailable.

Adds attraction information for multiple global cities
Introduces a new module that contains detailed information about popular attractions in cities including Amsterdam, London, New York City, Paris, and more. Each entry includes the title, location, image URL, tags, and popularity status, enhancing the application's ability to provide users with valuable insights into global destinations.
This addition aims to improve user experience by offering a comprehensive guide to attractions, making it easier for users to explore and plan their visits.

Adds detailed attraction information for multiple cities
Introduces a comprehensive data structure containing attraction details for cities including Amsterdam, London, New York City, and more.
Each entry includes descriptions, opening hours, entry fees, accessibility features, and ratings to enhance user experience and facilitate better planning for visitors.
This addition aims to improve the application's functionality and user engagement by providing rich, accessible information about popular attractions worldwide.

Refactors city attraction data handling to streamline access
Updates the method for retrieving city attraction data by replacing the previous approach with a new function that utilizes city files.
This change simplifies the logic and improves maintainability by reducing redundancy.
Removes unused code related to simple attraction data handling, enhancing clarity and performance.

Updates city attraction reference in data generator
Replaces the usage of `cityAttractions` with `attractionBasicInfo` to streamline the data generation process for city titles.
This change enhances the accuracy of generated titles by utilizing a more relevant source of attraction information, ensuring better alignment with the overall data structure.

Standardizes attraction keys and adds new entries for Cape Town
Refactors attraction keys to use hyphenated format for consistency across locations.
Adds detailed information for three attractions in Cape Town: Table Mountain, Robben Island, and Cape of Good Hope, enhancing the dataset for better user experience and information retrieval.

Removes unused imports and refactors code for clarity
Eliminates redundant `stat` and `readFile` imports across multiple scripts to streamline code.
Improves overall readability and maintainability by removing unnecessary functions and imports.
Ensures consistent coding practices throughout the project.
